page.title: 09THE UNDERSHAW HOTEL
page.content: THE UNDERSHAW HOTEL GOT ITS NAME FROM 'SHAW', AN OLD NAME FOR 'WOODED GROUND'.THIS HOTEL REALLY WAS SITUATED UNDER WOODED GROUND. SIR ARTHUR CONAN DOYLE LIVED IN THIS HOTEL WHEN IT WAS A HOUSE. HE WROTE THE STORIES OF SHERLOCK HOLMES AND WHEN HE WAS WRITING HE WOULD OFTEN TRY OUT THE THINGS HE WAS WRITING ABOUT. E.G. HE TOOK DRUGS WHEN HE WAS WRITING ABOUT A DRUG ADDICT. CONAN DOYLE CAME TO HINDHEAD BECAUSE AT THAT TIME HIS WIFE WAS SUFFERING FROM TUBERCULOSIS, AND THE AIR IN HINDHEAD WAS SAID TO BE BENEFICIAL TO SUCH SUFFERERS. CONAN DOYLE'S FAMILY TREE REMAINS ETCHED IN STAINED GLASS, AS DO THE SPECIALLY BUILT SHALLOW STAIRS. FANS OF THE WRITER, ESPECIALLY THOSE WITH A BELIEF IN THE SUPERNATURAL, STILL HOPE TO SEE HIS GHOST HERE.
